column4: the fact that i cannot unmount this ntfs partition is bothering far more than anything i have ever experienced
terminal  type  blkid  find the dev/tree of the ntfs partiton ,  sudo umount /dev/tree
thanks
it worked ? great
no
lol i meant thanks for trying
what is the mount poing of your ntfs partiton ?   sudo umount /mountpoing
it's /media/media when i sudo umount /media/media . . ."device is busy"    that's funny. . .the disk is *completely empty*
busy means something is trying to access , restart the computer that shoudl kill all the apps
yeah that's what i'm trying to avoid. . .*sigh*  what the eff is trying to access an empty hard drive?  lol
could be a lot of things,  .trash, opened nautilus windows, etc
right
thanks, and actually, i'm glad. . .killing the X server was enough to do it
u said nautilus and i realized it was probably a program that relied on X
so. . .bloop
so it is ok now ?
yeah thanks
actualy he was telling you off
lol
wouldn't be the first time i got told off by a foreigner of some kind
you're probably a foreigner to 2/3 of the ppl in this channel
i realize that, and meant no disrespect by calling whomever foreigner. . .u see , i'm a US Marine, and foreigners of countries we are occupying love to tell us off lol
